description: Creates a custom slot type. To create a custom slot type, specify a name for the slot type and a set of enumeration values, the values that a slot of this type can assume.

parameters.name: slotTypeName
parameters.description: The name for the slot. A slot type name must be unique within the intent.

parameters.name: slotTypeValues
parameters.description: A list of SlotTypeValue objects that defines the values that the slot type can take. Each value can have a list of synonyms, additional values that help train the machine learning model about the values that it resolves for a slot. (dict) --- Each slot type can have a set of values. Each SlotTypeValue represents a value that the slot type can take. sampleValue (dict) --- The value of the slot type entry. The value that can be used for a slot type. synonyms (list) --- Additional values related to the slot type entry. (dict) --- Defines one of the values for a slot type. The value that can be used for a slot type.

nested_params.name: sampleValue
nested_params.description: The value of the slot type entry.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The value that can be used for a slot type.

nested_params.name: synonyms
nested_params.description: Additional values related to the slot type entry.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The value that can be used for a slot type.

parameters.name: valueSelectionSetting
parameters.description: Determines the strategy that Amazon Lex uses to select a value from the list of possible values. The field can be set to one of the following values: ORIGINAL_VALUE - Returns the value entered by the user, if the user value is similar to the slot value. TOP_RESOLUTION - If there is a resolution list for the slot, return the first value in the resolution list. If there is no resolution list, return null. If you don't specify the valueSelectionSetting parameter, the default is ORIGINAL_VALUE. Determines the slot resolution strategy that Amazon Lex uses to return slot type values. TOP_RESOLUTION - If there is a resolution list for the slot, return the first value in the resolution list as the slot type value. If there is no resolution list, null is returned. If you don't specify the valueSelectionStrategy, the default is ORIGINAL_VALUE. regexFilter (dict) --- A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot. A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot. Use a standard regular expression. Amazon Lex supports the following characters in the regular expression: A-Z, a-z 0-9 Unicode characters ('- u<Unicode>') Represent Unicode characters with four digits, for example '- u0041' or '- u005A'. The following regular expression operators are not supported: Infinite repeaters: *, +, or {x,} with no upper bound. Wild card (.) advancedRecognitionSetting (dict) --- Provides settings that enable advanced recognition settings for slot values. You can use this to enable using slot values as a custom vocabulary for recognizing user utterances. audioRecognitionStrategy (string) --- Enables using the slot values as a custom vocabulary for recognizing user utterances.

parameters.name: parentSlotTypeSignature
parameters.description: The built-in slot type used as a parent of this slot type. When you define a parent slot type, the new slot type has the configuration of the parent slot type. Only AMAZON.AlphaNumeric is supported.

parameters.name: botId
parameters.description: The identifier of the bot associated with this slot type.

parameters.name: botVersion
parameters.description: The identifier of the bot version associated with this slot type.

parameters.name: localeId
parameters.description: The identifier of the language and locale that the slot type will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the bots, intents, and slots used by the slot type must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

parameters.name: externalSourceSetting
parameters.description: Sets the type of external information used to create the slot type. grammarSlotTypeSetting (dict) --- Settings required for a slot type based on a grammar that you provide. source (dict) --- The source of the grammar used to create the slot type. The name of the Amazon S3 bucket that contains the grammar source. The path to the grammar in the Amazon S3 bucket. kmsKeyArn (string) --- The KMS key required to decrypt the contents of the grammar, if any.

nested_params.name: grammarSlotTypeSetting
nested_params.description: Settings required for a slot type based on a grammar that you provide.

nested_params.name: source
nested_params.description: The source of the grammar used to create the slot type.

nested_params.name: s3BucketName
nested_params.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket that contains the grammar source.

nested_params.name: s3ObjectKey
nested_params.description: The path to the grammar in the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: kmsKeyArn
nested_params.description: The KMS key required to decrypt the contents of the grammar, if any.

parameters.name: compositeSlotTypeSetting
parameters.description: Specifications for a composite slot type. subSlots (list) --- Subslots in the composite slot. (dict) --- Subslot type composition. Name of a constituent sub slot inside a composite slot. The unique identifier assigned to a slot type. This refers to either a built-in slot type or the unique slotTypeId of a custom slot type.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: Name of a constituent sub slot inside a composite slot.

nested_params.name: slotTypeId
nested_params.description: The unique identifier assigned to a slot type. This refers to either a built-in slot type or the unique slotTypeId of a custom slot type.

nested_items.name: slotTypeId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier assigned to the slot type. Use this to identify the slot type in the UpdateSlotType and DeleteSlotType operations.

nested_items.name: slotTypeName
nested_items.description: The name specified for the slot type.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description specified for the slot type.

nested_items.name: slotTypeValues
nested_items.description: The list of values that the slot type can assume.

nested_items.name: sampleValue
nested_items.description: The value of the slot type entry.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value that can be used for a slot type.

nested_items.description: Additional values related to the slot type entry.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value that can be used for a slot type.

nested_items.name: valueSelectionSetting
nested_items.description: The strategy that Amazon Lex uses to select a value from the list of possible values.

nested_items.name: resolutionStrategy
nested_items.description: Determines the slot resolution strategy that Amazon Lex uses to return slot type values. The field can be set to one of the following values:
ORIGINAL_VALUE - Returns the value entered by the user, if the user value is similar to the slot value.
TOP_RESOLUTION - If there is a resolution list for the slot, return the first value in the resolution list as the slot type value. If there is no resolution list, null is returned.

nested_items.name: regexFilter
nested_items.description: A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.

nested_items.name: pattern
nested_items.description: A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.
A-Z, a-z.
Unicode characters ('- u<Unicode>')

nested_items.name: advancedRecognitionSetting
nested_items.description: Provides settings that enable advanced recognition settings for slot values. You can use this to enable using slot values as a custom vocabulary for recognizing user utterances.

nested_items.name: audioRecognitionStrategy
nested_items.description: Enables using the slot values as a custom vocabulary for recognizing user utterances.

nested_items.name: parentSlotTypeSignature
nested_items.description: The signature of the base slot type specified for the slot type.

nested_items.name: botId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the bot associated with the slot type.

nested_items.name: botVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the bot associated with the slot type.

nested_items.name: localeId
nested_items.description: The specified language and local specified for the slot type.

nested_items.name: creationDateTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp of the date and time that the slot type was created.

nested_items.name: externalSourceSetting
nested_items.description: The type of external information used to create the slot type.

nested_items.name: grammarSlotTypeSetting
nested_items.description: Settings required for a slot type based on a grammar that you provide.

nested_items.name: s3BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket that contains the grammar source.

nested_items.name: s3ObjectKey
nested_items.description: The path to the grammar in the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyArn
nested_items.description: The KMS key required to decrypt the contents of the grammar, if any.

nested_items.description: Specifications for a composite slot type.

nested_items.name: subSlots
nested_items.description: Subslots in the composite slot.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: Name of a constituent sub slot inside a composite slot.

nested_items.description: The unique identifier assigned to a slot type. This refers to either a built-in slot type or the unique slotTypeId of a custom slot type.
